title: Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) via Analytics Reports
content:
Hello Gents, I would like to report an issue where attackers are able to read internal files via an SSRF vulnerability.
Proof of concept
███
Impact
SSRF.
Thanks and have a nice day!
steps: Identify the analytics reports feature in the application that allows for URL inputs.
Craft a malicious URL pointing to an internal file (e.g., file:///etc/passwd) and submit it via the analytics reports feature.
vuln_description: The vulnerability allows an attacker to perform Server Side Request Forgery (SSRF) by manipulating the analytics reports feature to read internal files. This is achieved by inputting a malicious URL that the server processes, leading to unauthorized access to sensitive data.
reason: The attack involves a straightforward manipulation of the URL input in the analytics reports feature without requiring complex interactions or state manipulations. The vulnerability is a common SSRF flaw, which is well-documented and does not involve novel logic.
